autoScalingMetric.description: Metric your cluster will track in order to scale in and out. For example, CPU_UTILIZATION_PERCENTAGE is the average CPU usage across all nodes in a cluster.

maxNodeCount.description: Highest number of nodes to scale. Cannot be greater than 5

metricTarget.description: Desired value of chosen `auto_scaling_metric`. When metric drops below this value, cluster will scale in. When metric goes above this value, cluster will scale out. Can be set between 0 and 100 percent.

minNodeCount.description: Lowest number of nodes to scale. Must be at least 1 and less than the `max_node_count`. If nodes in cluster belong to multiple availability zones, then `min_node_count` must be at least 3.

scaleInCooldownSeconds.description: Duration in seconds that FinSpace will wait after a scale in event before initiating another scaling event.

scaleOutCooldownSeconds.description: Duration in seconds that FinSpace will wait after a scale out event before initiating another scaling event.
